'''The Copper Age''' is a [[game drop]] that was released on September 30, 2025 as [[Java Edition 1.21.9]] and [[Bedrock Edition 1.21.111]].<ref>{{Mcnet|minecraft-java-edition-1-21-9|Minecraft Java Edition 1.21.9|September 30, 2025}}</ref><ref>{{citation|url=https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/39932063411213-Minecraft-Bedrock-Edition-1-21-111-The-Copper-Age|title=Minecraft: Bedrock Edition 1.21.111 - The Copper Age|website=Minecraft Feedback|date=September 30, 2025}}</ref>  Its theme is about new copper uses. It introduced [[copper armor]] and [[tool]]s, [[copper nugget]]s, and also others like various [[copper]] decorations, [[copper golem]]s, [[copper golem statue]]s, and [[shelves]].

During development, the update was referred to as '''Fall Drop 2025''' and '''Drop 3 2025'''. The final name of the update was revealed in a [[Minecraft.net]] article on August 28, 2025.<ref name="reference">{{Mcnet|third-game-drop-2025-name-announce|Our next game drop has a name|August 28, 2025|Linn Viberg}}</ref>

== Additions ==
=== Blocks ===
'''{{animate|Copper Bars (EW) JE1.png;Exposed Copper Bars (EW) JE1.png;Weathered Copper Bars (EW) JE1.png;Oxidized Copper Bars (EW) JE1.png|32px}} [[Copper bars]]'''
* A new type of [[bars]].
* [[Oxidize]]s over time.
* Can be waxed like other copper blocks.
* Crafted using 6 [[copper ingot]]s.

'''{{animate|Copper Chain (UD) JE1.png;Exposed Copper Chain (UD) JE1.png;Weathered Copper Chain (UD) JE1.png;Oxidized Copper Chain (UD) JE1.png|32px}} [[Copper chain]]'''
* A new type of [[chain]].
* Oxidizes over time.
* Can be waxed like other copper blocks.
* Crafted using a [[copper ingot]] and 2 copper nuggets.

'''{{animate|Copper Chest (S) BE1.png;Exposed Copper Chest (S) BE1.png;Weathered Copper Chest (S) BE1.png;Oxidized Copper Chest (S) BE1.png|32px}} [[Copper chest]]'''
* A new type of [[chest]].
* Oxidizes over time.
* Can be waxed like other copper blocks.
* Crafted using a [[chest]] and [[copper ingot]]s.
* Can be spawned by placing a [[carved pumpkin]] or [[jack o'lantern]] on top of a [[block of copper]] and also spawning a [[copper golem]] on top.
* Can be interacted with by [[copper golem]]s.
* Placing two will create a large copper chest, like the wooden large chest.

'''{{animate|Copper Golem Statue BE1.png;Exposed Copper Golem Statue BE1.png;Weathered Copper Golem Statue BE1.png;Oxidized Copper Golem Statue BE1.png|32px}} [[Copper golem statue]]'''
* After a [[copper golem]] reaches full oxidation, it will become a copper golem statue, with a random pose.
* Oxidizes over time.
* Can be waxed like other copper blocks.
* Pose can be changed by interacting with it. 
* Every pose has a unique comparator signal.
* The poses are Standing (default), Running, Sitting, and Star.
* {{ctrl|Using}} an axe on a copper golem statue will remove oxidation and eventually bring it back to life.

'''{{animate|Copper Lantern.gif;Exposed Copper Lantern.gif;Weathered Copper Lantern.gif;Oxidized Copper Lantern.gif|32px}} [[Copper lantern]]'''
* A new type of [[lantern]].
* Oxidizes over time.
* Can be waxed like other copper blocks.
* Crafted using a [[copper torch]] surrounded by 8 copper nuggets.

'''[[File:Copper Torch.gif|32px]] [[Copper torch]]'''
* A new type of [[torch]].
* Does not oxidize.
* Crafted using a [[stick]], [[coal]] and [[copper nugget]].

'''{{animate|Exposed Lightning Rod (U) JE1.png;Weathered Lightning Rod (U) JE1.png;Oxidized Lightning Rod (U) JE1.png|32px}} [[Lightning rod]] (oxidised variants)'''
* Added exposed, weathered, and oxidized variants of lightning rods.
* Lightning rods now oxidize and can be waxed like other copper blocks.
* If not waxed, lightning rods struck by lightning will return to their unoxidized state.

'''{{animate|Spruce Shelf.png; Oak Shelf.png; Birch Shelf.png; Dark Oak Shelf.png; Pale Oak Shelf.png; Mangrove Shelf.png; Cherry Shelf.png; Crimson Shelf.png; Warped Shelf.png; Bamboo Shelf.png|32px}} [[Shelf]]'''
* A new storage block.
* Crafted using [[stripped logs]].
* Can store 3 stacks of items.
* When powered by redstone, its front texture changes.
* When powered by redstone, interacting with the block will swap the rightmost items in the hotbar with the contents of the shelf.
* Can be connected to other shelves to switch out more than just three hotbar slots.

=== Items ===
'''{{InvSprite|Copper Helmet}} {{InvSprite|Copper Chestplate}} {{InvSprite|Copper Leggings}} {{InvSprite|Copper Boots}} [[Copper armor]]'''
* Added [[copper helmet]], [[copper chestplate]], [[copper leggings]] and [[copper boots]].
* Copper armor has higher [[armor points]] than [[leather armor]] but less than [[golden armor]]. Its [[durability]] is higher than golden armor but less than [[chainmail armor|chainmail]] and [[iron armor]]. It has an [[enchantability]] of 8, less than iron armor (9) and giving it the lowest enchantability out of any armor type.
* Provides a total of {{armor|10}} armor points.

'''{{InvSprite|Copper Golem Spawn Egg}} [[Copper golem spawn egg]]'''
*Used to spawn a [[copper golem]]. Does not generate a [[copper chest]].

'''{{InvSprite|Copper Horse Armor}} [[Copper horse armor]]'''
* A new type of [[horse armor]].
* Provides {{armor|4}} armor points.
* Generates in the same loot tables with the same chances as [[iron horse armor]].
* Cannot be crafted.

'''{{InvSprite|Copper Nugget}} [[Copper nugget]]'''
* Copper equipment turns into copper nuggets when smelted.
* Nine copper nuggets can be turned into a [[copper ingot]], and vice versa.

'''{{InvSprite|Copper Axe}} {{InvSprite|Copper Hoe}} {{InvSprite|Copper Pickaxe}} {{InvSprite|Copper Shovel}} {{InvSprite|Copper Sword}} [[Copper tools]] and [[weapons]]'''
* Added [[copper axe]]s, [[copper hoe]]s, [[copper pickaxe]]s, [[copper shovel]]s, and [[copper sword]]s.

* Copper [[tool]]s and [[weapon]]s are crafted and repaired using [[copper ingot]]s. They do the same amount of damage as stone but have higher [[durability]]. Copper tools have higher [[mining efficiency]] than stone tools, but less than iron tools. Copper tools have an [[enchantability]] of 13, higher than diamond (10) but less than iron (14).

=== Mobs ===
'''{{Animate|Copper Golem BE1.png;Exposed Copper Golem BE1.png;Weathered Copper Golem BE1.png;Oxidized Copper Golem BE1.png|32px}} [[Copper golem]]'''
* Can be built with a [[carved pumpkin]] or [[jack o'lantern]] placed on a [[block of copper]], creating a [[copper chest]] along with the golem.
* Drops between 1 and 3 [[copper ingot]]s when killed.
* Automatically picks up [[item]]s from [[copper chest]]s and sort them into [[chest]]s and [[trapped chest]]s.
* The golem does this by taking an item out and carrying the item in its hand to a chest.
* Will only put the item in a chest that is empty or already has 1 or more of the item.
* Can pick up a max of 16 items in a stack at a time.
* Can open non-iron [[door]]s.
* Oxidizes just like copper blocks do, can be waxed, and loses [[oxidation]] when struck by [[lightning]]. It does not take [[damage]] from lightning.
* When it fully oxidizes, it becomes a [[copper golem statue]] and freezes in a random pose.
* Can have a [[poppy]] placed on its head when interacted by an [[iron golem]] in which case said poppy can be sheared.

=== Graphics ===
[[File:Java end flash.png|thumb|An End flash.]]
'''[[End sky]]'''
* Added the [[End flash]] to {{JE}} which makes the sky periodically emit purple glow and play various sounds. These were previously only {{in|be}} with [[Vibrant Visuals]] enabled.
** Block lighting becomes purple tinted during the flash, which is more noticeable on lower brightness settings.
** There is a 30 second delay between flashes.
** Each flash lasts between 5 and 19 seconds.
** While the ender dragon fog effect is active the flash source in the sky is not visible and the brightness of the light affecting the world is reduced.

== Changes ==
=== Blocks ===
'''[[File:Chain (UD) JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Iron chain]]'''
* Renamed from "Chain" to "Iron Chain" to distinguish it from the copper chain.

'''[[File:Copper Trapdoor JE2 BE2.png|32px]] [[Copper trapdoor]]'''
* The crafting recipe now uses 4 [[copper ingot]]s, instead of 6.
* The crafting recipe now produces 1 copper trapdoor instead of 2.
{{Crafting
|A1 = Copper Ingot
|A2 = Copper Ingot
|B1 = Copper Ingot
|B2 = Copper Ingot
|Output = Copper Trapdoor
|ignoreusage = 1
}}

=== Items ===
'''{{InvSprite|White Dye}} {{InvSprite|Light Gray Dye}} {{InvSprite|Gray Dye}} {{InvSprite|Black Dye}} {{InvSprite|Brown Dye}} {{InvSprite|Red Dye}} {{InvSprite|Orange Dye}} {{InvSprite|Yellow Dye}} {{InvSprite|Lime Dye}} {{InvSprite|Green Dye}} {{InvSprite|Cyan Dye}} {{InvSprite|Light Blue Dye}} {{InvSprite|Blue Dye}} {{InvSprite|Purple Dye}} {{InvSprite|Magenta Dye}} {{InvSprite|Pink Dye}} [[Dye]]s'''
* Updated all dye textures.
** This was done to enhance visual cohesion across the dye set while maintaining distinct shapes to support color blindness accessibility.
** Each dye now has a unique shape, and appears on a brown palette.

=== Mobs ===
'''[[File:Iron Golem JE2 BE2.png|32px]] [[Iron golem]]'''
* Can now interact with the [[copper golem]] by planting a [[poppy]] on them.

=== The Copper Cape Quest ===
{{Update|section=Section mode}}
{{See also|The Copper Age (skin pack)}}
[[File:Copper Cape Quest Banner.jpeg|frameless|center]]
To promote the release of the drop, a special three-part community challenge has begun on September 30, 2025. Players will try to complete three challenges to earn the Copper Cape. By completing the first two challenges, all ''Bedrock Edition'' players will earn the two character creator items, and all ''Java Edition'' players will earn a skin pack. The third challenge requires individual players' participation to earn the cape.<ref>{{Mcnet|the-copper-cape-quest|The Copper Cape Quest is Officially Afoot|September 30, 2025|Sofia Dankis}}</ref>
# '''First Challenge''': ''Players must summon at least 75 million copper golems between September 30‚ÄìOctober 6, 2025.''<ref>{{Tweet|Minecraft|1973108331112808519|‚õèÔ∏èTake on The Copper Cape Quest, a three-part community challenge!<br><br>First up: help summon 75 million copper golems from 8am PDT Sep 30 to 10am PDT Oct 6 2025. If completed, we all earn in-game items in Bedrock and Java, plus unlock our next challenge!<br><br>Learn more here! aka.ms/CopperCapeQuest|September 30, 2025}}</ref>
# '''Second Challenge''': ''Players must uses their Copper golems need to organize 500 million items between October 7‚Äì13, 2025.''<ref>{{Mcnet|the-copper-cape-quest-continues|The Copper Cape Quest Continues|October 7, 2025|Sofia Dankis}}</ref>
# '''Final Challenge''': ''Players must choose either one of the following tasks in order to obtain the cape''.<ref>{{Mcnet|the-copper-cape-quest-is-almost-over|The Copper Cape Quest Is Almost-Over|10/13/2025|Sofia Dankis}}</ref>
## ''Pick up a copper golem statue and place it somewhere {{in|BE}} in any game mode. When done, you get your cape by October 31 in the Dressing Room (Bedrock only).''

=== The Copper Crown ===
{{Main|The Copper Crown}}
As part of the drop's promotion, a special edition of [[MC Championship]] was announced, organized in collaboration between [[Mojang Studios]] and [[Twitch]]. As with prior editions, it features several figures from across the community, including [[Seapeekay]], [[CaptainSparklez]], [[hannahxxrose]], and [[Grian]]. It took place on October 19, 2025, 18:00 UTC at the 2025 edition of {{w|Twitch Rivals}}.
